A blood type is a classification of blood based on the presence and absence of 
antibodies and also based on the presence or absence of inherited antigenic 
substances on the surface of red blood cells (RBCs). These antigens may be 
proteins, carbohydrates, glycoproteins, or glycolipids ... Blood types are inherited 
and represent contributions from both parents.
